segments.text: I notice the woman standing at the sink, her back turned to the bubbling chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems content with her task, drying the dishes, blissfully unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the water spills over the edges, creating a small lake on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see the mess that’s only getting worse with every passing second?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is teetering on that stool as though he were on a tightrope, reaching for something forbidden.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away; it’s like watching a slow-motion disaster unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl beside him, eagerly stretching her arm out, full of hope and excitement.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her innocence is heartwarming but also makes me feel more anxious for their safety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing is so surreal, the chaos inside contrasting with the quiet garden outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the potential for disaster and can’t help but feel a bit frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will someone get hurt if she doesn’t turn around? It just feels inevitable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem so excited by their little adventure, completely oblivious to the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could shout a warning, but I know it would ruin the moment for them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water continues to trickle down, and I wonder how much longer until everything spirals out of control.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s an ordinary day here, yet it feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR
